alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Nicholas and east central Fayette Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Babcock State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rainelle. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 25 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas
